pr_title: Add support for file:// url for copying .mar files into model store

timeline.message: Add support for file:// url for copying .mar files into model store
Adding UT for local model file

timeline.bodyText:
This test case only tests the "mar file already exists" scenario. Please add test cases for the following use cases:

Valid local mar file URL, validate that the mar file correctly gets copied to the model-store.
URL path does not exist
timeline.author: harshbafna

timeline.message: Adding test to check if mar file is getting copied locally when file:// is used
Adding test cases for local mar file register and un-registration

timeline.author: harshbafna

timeline.bodyText: Ideally, we should never encounter this exception. If we do, that means something went wrong. It would be better to add the exception with throws.
timeline.author: harshbafna

replies.bodyText:
Please see inline comments.
The test case for URL path does not exist is still missing in both ModelArchiveTest and ModelServerTest

In ModelArchiveTest.java - We already have a test to check invalid URL - testMalformLocalUrl.
In ModelServerTest.java - we have added a new test case - testModelWithInvalidFileUri
replies.author: shrinath-suresh

timeline.bodyText: clean up the fileUrl as well.
timeline.author: harshbafna

replies.bodyText: @harshbafna In this testcase, we copied mnist.mar from resources folder as mnist1.mar. In the end we have deleted mnist1.mar (fileUrl variable is just a URL like "file://path) .
replies.author: shrinath-suresh

timeline.bodyText: make this test case dependent on testLoadModelFromFileURI.
timeline.author: harshbafna

timeline.bodyText: NIT: Can't we just use file:///<path> as the url and remove the if-else here?
timeline.author: maaquib

replies.bodyText:
NIT: Can't we just use file:///<path> as the url and remove the if-else here?

@maaquib  FileUtils.copyURLToFile is a two step process. It downloads the file from URL and copies it to the destination. if we pass file://<path> as url, step one would fail.
replies.author: shrinath-suresh

replies.bodyText: @maaquib Thanks. Removed the if else block. Just the pattern change is enough for accommodating file://
replies.author: shrinath-suresh

timeline.message: Using FileUtils.copyURLToFile for file:// url as well
Merge branch 'issue_643' of github.com:shrinath-suresh/serve into issue_643
